turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: FUCK YOU!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: GET IN HERE GODDAMMIT!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: They're gonna give on this in the next ten seconds or the deal's off!

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: I dunno what to say to you sweetheart, it is what it is.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Bullshit it is. I said, about as loud as I could say it, "no jail time for my guys."

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: Baby, I've been co-habitating with these people for the past thirty odd hours and in so doing, have stared into the face of hell. These are the premier prick cocksuckers of all time and I feel beaten by them, I feel bloodied --

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: -- and you're gonna feel altogether fucked, by me, if you don't handle this. I'm the one, does the face plant, this falls apart, not you.

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: And I vibe that kiddo, I do indeed, but it's one'a those fait accompli things, you have to --

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: I don't have to do shit! Which includes cooperating any further with these motherfuckers until I get what I want!  Alright, fuck it, if we gotta hand 'em somebody from our end and they're being hard-ons about it -- make it Hugo, him I don't mind. He needs that regimented thing that prison provides --

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: -- Buddy, it's bigger than that, they want 'em all, Ivy, Beanie --

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: -- this isn't a swap meet Morrey, they're getting Sparazza and the west coast syndicate, giftwrapped, now if that's not good enough --

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: Buddy, they revoked the deal, they pulled it...

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: They what? What? No. No. Why?

turns.speaker: MECKLEN
turns.text: The Deputy Director, this prick Locke, he smashed the whole thing, we're done, they won't tell me why...

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Sparazza is rumored to have performed in excess of one-hundred and thirty contract murders, including one of the bureau's most celebrated agents. Freeman Heller. You heard of "The Turnpike Murders" that was Sparazza.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: I thought Heller was a double op?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: So he's personally issued the contract on Israel?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Sparazza was the one who introduced Israel to the life, gave him his first big break, brought him through the ranks.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: A marked man gets wise and wants to come in.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: His testimony has the potential of blowing the lid off what's left of the La Cosa Nostra is this country. That alone warrants total immunity from prosecution and and a vanishing act with Witness Protection.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: So the wiretaps we conducted on Serna and Padiche, the mention of Israel's heart?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: -- Your intel corroborates what we already know. Sparazza's health is in rapid decline and before his date with destiny, it seems he wants one last thing... The heart of his sworn enemy. A recently opened, cash rich escrow account has been traced back to Sparazza. This and the mention of this mysterious Swede makes the million dollar contract on Israel very real.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: On an extradition flight back to El Salvador, he murdered a security detachment and vanished.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: You think it's possible he could be involved in the Israel hit?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Possibly. Acosta is pure mercenary. And a million dollar hit fee will draw some huge flies. But forget about Sparazza's money for a moment and remember, there's no shortage of those who want Israel killed and no shortage of cash to do just that...

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: It's the last place they'd look.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Israel's legal representation, the firm of Culpepper, Brody and Reed, which is currently the subject of a joint SEC and Treasury Department probe, were left holding the bag after he skipped bail. Over three- quarters of a million dollars on a bond that's set to expire in less than a day. Rupert Reed, one of the firm's partners, has learned of Israel's whereabouts and dispatched a local bondsman by the name of Jack Dupree to pick him up and return him to Las Vegas... that can't happen.  We have a Gulf Stream standing by at Reagan International to transport you two to Lake Tahoe.  It's very simple gentlemen. Valacchi, Fratiano, Gravano -- no former witness against the mob has been as crucial or has brought more to bear on the potential dissolution of The La Cosa Nostra, than Buddy Israel.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Here. Sit.   Please.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: This is him? The hitman hired to kill Israel? He's a doctor?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Difficult to explain everything now...  And much larger issues loom.  I'm sorry about Carruthers... Damndest thing to have to die for.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: What the hell -- What is this!? People died. Agent Carruthers is dead!

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: We have to transport Mr. Israel to Las Vegas, time is of the essence. The gulfstream is standing by on the jetway at Tahoe International. I'm sorry, I'm restricted from disclosing anymore information. Return to Washington. You'll be debriefed in the coming days.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Where's Israel?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: My debrief --

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: -- will be handled back in --

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: -- no, we need to handle it now.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: I can't discuss --

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: -- You can and you will.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: You're finished.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: And you just figured that out?  The Swede isn't a hitman, is he? He's a surgeon. Sparazza didn't want Israel's heart for a trophy, he wanted it for a transplant... why?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...A paternity suit, filed 1967...

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: -- Brought against Sparazza by Israel's mother Laverne who was nineteen at the time. They had a brief affair which Israel was the by- product of.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...Does he know?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: ...He does now...

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Sparazza was in failing health and looking for a donor. The son who had betrayed and burned him so thoroughly seemed a obvious choice.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: So all of our intel was bogus to begin with.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Yes. The actual contract went to Lazlo Soot, the man that plunged to his death from the Penthouse yesterday. He was to neutralize Israel's entourage and prep for the removal of his heart. Ingstrom was to handle the surgery itself on-site with the assistance of Dr. Gregory Gill, Israel's personal physician, who was also on the Sparazza payroll.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...When did you know all this?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Information was arriving all day yesterday. When we finally figured out who Sparazza actually was, we --

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: ...Are you insane?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...Almost.  What do you mean "who Sparazza actually was..."

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: You realize that Sparraza has had thirty-six major medical procedures performed on him since 1953? Elective plastic surgery, every single one --

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: It wasn't elective. It was undertaken to save his life. And it wasn't cosmetic, it was reconstructive... Look at the date of the first procedure.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...Yeah, fifty-three.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: The same year that Sparazza murdered Agent Freeman Heller...

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...holy shit... that's Heller...  Isn't it?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: Primo Sparazza was Heller's alias. He went deep cover in 1940 and stayed under for over ten years, amassing materials against the mafia and other criminal syndicates. He may have ripped the organization wide open, pre-Appalachia, but his superiors were convinced that he had gone rogue, swapped allegiances...So they gave the order to terminate his cover.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: The agents of that era are all dead and gone, history had defaulted to fable... until now. You can imagine the shock this sent through the corridors of power in D.C. Heller's op predates the second world war. That's over sixty years of intel. Do you know how valuable that could be? The man's a treasure trove.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...So you made another deal?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: I wouldn't go that far.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: But you did, and have... And now people are dead.  Did Sparazza become more valuable than Israel... and did you make another deal?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: You're trying to save Sparazza?

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: No... We're trying to save Heller.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...So you knew all this and yet y--

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: -- We needed cohesion to move forward. Not conjecture.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: ...while Carruthers and a dozen others lie dying, you debate semantics. The Bureau's betrayed us...  The way they betrayed him...

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: I don't see it like that at all.

turns.speaker: LOCKE
turns.text: I'll overlook what you've done here today in light of what's taken place. You've been fully debriefed. Now I want you to return to D.C. immediately and make no further inquiry into this matter. I mean it. It's closed.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: No... It's not.  What it lacks... is an end.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Buzzy... Buzz...?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Yeah... Sid?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: You got clicks, anything?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Nah, nuthin' on my end --

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: -- Okay... hang on, I gotta move --

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Alright, now Buzzy -- this is, this is it, here, okay, so listen to me careful and wait till I'm finished 'cuz we got no room for slop.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Okay, he's gonna clip Israel, I just gotta outta there --

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: -- he's doing it then, huh --

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: -- yeah, now lemme finish, I was eavesdroppin', so give me sec, lay this thing out, since the information might be a little loose --

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: -- okay, g'head --

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: So what I heard downstairs there is that they got a guy, some Swede, real badass, supposedly a "specialist" and they're bringing him over. Now he ain't coming cheap -- so, I'm thinkin' we jump, do this in the next day or so, get to Israel before the Swede can, we got chits, y'see? We're in a power position. Grab him, ransom him back, pick up that nut, we're that much closer to having our own thing.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: No question, no, you're right. We gotta do what's good for us now.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Fuckin' A, first survive, yes?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Y'gotta, y'gotta. But d'ya think they'll kick ransom for that little prick, assuming we get to'm.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Yeah, y'ain't heard the punchline, yet and before I get to it, one more thing I heard, little curious, should probably bring it up... Primo wants Israel's heart. The actual thing, the organ.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: ... Jesus... what for?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: -- who can say. He's off his onion, y'know, he's old school Sicilian, this is how they hate.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Hey, we nab Israel, they pay t'get'm back, I'll cut the fuckin' thing out m'self, no extra charge. My thing is, we crew up, let's not fuck around, someone's cousin, some Zip off the boat from Naples, let's get pros, people who know how to behave.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Yeah, there's a pair'a broads I'm thinking might be good for this.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Chances are, they're gonna get into some shit too, hafta put people down.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: That's not a problem. Are we goin' outta pocket ourselves?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Yeah, I can front this.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Well just so I got a quote in my head. What's the rate for the Swede?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: That's the punchline, y'ready?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: A million flat.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: None whatsoever.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Buzzy... Buzz...?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Yeah... Sid?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Right, you got clicks, anything?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Nah, nuthin' on my end --

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: So how we lookin'?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Good. This thing's on track, looks like it's gonna get done.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Fuckin' thrilled t'hear it. So the scout, the sitdown, y'musta felt it from 'em then huh?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Cold blood Sid, dead eyes, y'know?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Lil' cagey, y'know, don't like t'share trade secrets, that type'a thing.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Okay -- yeah, I can, I respect that.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: How are we on time...?

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Well, I'm hearin' the Swede's been dispatched, he's flying so --

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: Well, uh -- damn, alright, so he's headed in, does that -- where does that leave us?

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: -- No, no, not when y'can see the shore. I hear ya.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Okay, well, y'know, then we just gotta get Israel.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: I'm working on it.

turns.speaker: SERNA
turns.text: Bag this fucker Buzzy.

turns.speaker: PADICHE
turns.text: It's gettin' done Sid.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: Georgia on my mind wit'yo fine ass. You know you saved this black man.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You know I did baby...  And a deep, dark one at that. Now if you ain't a dog, which you don't look like --

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: -- never in a million girl --

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: -- good, then all you got to be is grateful.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: No doubt. That's my moms there, taught me them skills.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You love her?

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: My mamma? C'mon shorty, y'gotta ask?  You hurtin' pretty bad?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Got hit twice.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: It's going around ain't it? Mafuckas catching bullets like the common cold up in this bitch.  I think I accidentally shot and killed my boy today.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Well, if it's any comfort, I's goin' in to there to act a fool baby.  Straight rockin' heat and slayin' niggas --

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: For real?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Mmm-hmm... and your boy very well mighta been one of 'em.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: True?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Like a mafucka.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: That takes some of the sting out.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I probably woulda busted on you too... and what a shame that woulda been.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: I feel like I know you girl. I feel like I've known you forever.  You gonna lemme see your scars?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You do the right thing. Sit with me while I heal, let it develop slow.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: What were you doin' here anyway?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: 'Spose to kill this fool named Buddy Israel.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: We gotta lay something out, strategy- wise. Somethin' tight. Y'go in there ad-libbing, it's y'ass.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: What are we talkin' on the split...

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: 'Cuz we don't need to draw any more shit down on our heads. We hit whoever's between us and Israel. I don't want to dead the whole floor and I don't want to be killing women no matter how they make a living.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Wait, I'm getting some fucked up feedback off that earpiece --

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Nuthin', we cool. There was somethin' about a fed being in the building.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: A Fed? Like FBI?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: It's just a little casino inspection, don't trip, he's alone.  Alright, let's set this spinnin'...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: When them tricks hit the lobby, holla at me and I'm gonna meet them on the way up, blend in. Once I get inside, I'mma put m'Nina to Israel's head and back out hot. Anybody's fucks with that program, y'break 'em off. They get gully --

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: I'mma grip and rip girl.  I got some handloads here ready to cut heads.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Jus' remember, this is more rescuin' shit than rampagin' shit... What are you shootin'?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: ...Girl, y'know I had to bring big mamma through.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You got the fifty up? Bitch y'tryin' t'take down a jumbo jet? Blown the moon out the sky? T'fuck you wanna get that grimy?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: The try t'wild out on my boo and it's on and crackin'! I'm layin' niggas out.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Damn, this kevlar ridin' up on me, I wish they made this more sheer.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: ...So you heard from Keith? He still fuckin' with that 'lil light-skinned girl?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I ain't tryin' to break a sweat for that sorry ass nigga.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: He a dog babydoll. He a great dane. I tried to tell y'after ya'll first date. He hit that ass one time, his interest in a bitch start t'landslide.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You know I burned all his shit. All that vinyl. Chalamar, Funkadelic, I burned his turntables too. They was like three-thousand brand new.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Fuck that nigga. Let him go woof on some other scrub. We got one another, s'all the love we're ever goin' need.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Girl, lemme ask you somethin' and I want you t'tell me straight up, since I got my suspicions and y'know I ain't one t'talk circles... you gay?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: What!?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Ain't nuthin' wrong wit' it.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Damn! Why you trippin' like that?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: -- I don't know, I feel like you always pushin' up on me, gettin' close and I love you baby, in every way you can love a bitch, 'cept that one.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: I ain't even goin' dignify that. You my road dog. We threw up sets.  Plus you stank.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Not you. Some assholes on the elevator... are these bitches on a permanent smoke break or what? Why the fuck they call'm "working girls."

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Are you anywhere near the penthouse?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: No, but that definitely sounds like shots and I don't where it's comin' from --

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: -- It's your IFB, somebody else has got an earpiece, you're picking up their signal --

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: -- I thought we had secure frequency. Aww girl, tell me this mafucka ain't goin' off right now.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Security's locking down the elevators.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'm not givin' it up jus' yet...

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: C'mon, I say we bounce now, kick it for a lil' bit, play some craps.  ...Maybe spend the night?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: ...Shhhhhhit... girl, there's these two dudes, just sittin' here in this elevator, all shot up...

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: They musta been beefin' big time with one another, cuz this shit, got way past words, whatever it was.

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: ...What are they doin' right now...?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Girl one of these fools has an FBI badge on him! Is this the one that was doing the inspection?

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: Hold up, hold up, I'm getting shots over the scanners, tons of traffic -- jus' chill for a sec, lemme listen...

turns.speaker: WATTERS
turns.text: I DON'T KNOW!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Jus' keep doin' y'damage girl, keep these mafuckas off my as--

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Bulllllshit...

turns.speaker: WYMAN
turns.text: Naw baby, they heard about that Triad hit, the work ya'll put in and they recognize the skills. And this ain't no tryout, tap-dance "show us your shit" thing neither -- if ya'll want this then I'mma go git it for 'ya.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: And so I get this straight, we gotta go in, bust on this punk and remove the heart? Is that for real?

turns.speaker: WYMAN
turns.text: No, no, no, y'gotta go in and get him, pull'm out of wherever he at, forget all that other shit, that's just f'flavor. I'm still getting lil' bits'a this-n-that from this cat Padiche, the man contacting me... Right now, what we got --  -- Is a number and a name... Buddy Israel.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What else did Padiche say?

turns.speaker: WYMAN
turns.text: He said that the shit could get hot, could get heavy... I said good.  'Cuz I got two of the hottest, heaviest bitches alive.

turns.speaker: WYMAN
turns.text: Forty-five apiece for you two, ten percent finders fee for me.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What's the time frame?

turns.speaker: WYMAN
turns.text: Right mafuck'n now girl. Fast as we can get you there. We wait any longer, someone goin' dead this fool.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Gibarian.

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: Leave the light off.

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: You think you're dreaming me, like you dream her.  Understand something: I am the real Gibarian.  Just a new incarnation.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: You're being tricked.  Sartorius picked a fight with you to avoid telling you about his idea for getting rid of the visitors.  He's figured out they're made of subatomic particles called neutrinos, and he's going to create a negative neutrino field.  Twenty four hours a day, until they're back on Earth.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Can it work?

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: It can.  Ordinary matter, like ours? Not affected.  Everything else, disintegrates.

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: What I'm saying is: Don't trust anyone.  Find yourself a weapon of some sort.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I can trust Rheya.

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: You'll end up like me.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You're not Gibarian...

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: No?  Who am I, then?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: A puppet.

turns.speaker: GIBARIAN
turns.text: And you're not?  Maybe you're my puppet.  But like all puppets, you think you're actually human.  It's The Puppet's Dream.  Wondering if they're human!

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: You have to give me your word you won't come in.  Then I'll come out.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What happened to Gibarian?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Didn't you talk to Snow?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I want to hear your version.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Who, here, could possibly care what you want?  At best, you're Employee of the Month for the highest bidder in the Solaris auction.  They have no idea what's going on up here. They've never even been in space. And I'm supposed to listen to you?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I am here to recover this mission, report my findings, and make a recommendation.  Now: What happened to him?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: The same thing that could happen to any of us.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Where's his body?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: In the lab.  With her, probably.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Her?  Who are you talking about?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: They shouldn't let people like you into space.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Just so you know: I'm not going back until I understand what it is.  I am going to figure out what it is, make it stop, and then I will go home.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Listen --

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: We're done.  Oh, I should tell you, I don't trust Snow.  There's something wrong with him.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: No.  There's no behavior modification.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: She reappeared exactly as she had before?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Meaning Man can do whatever the fuck it wants?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: That's fantastic.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Why did you agree to come here?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You killed her!

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Not her.  It.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You murdered her!

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Kelvin, she begged me.  I had a short- range version of the destabilizer prototype, a miniature with a range of a few meters.  She walked into it and disappeared.  She was gone.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: She'll come back.

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: No, she won't.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Why would you let her to do that?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: It's not human, Kelvin.  Whatever it is, it's not human, and I am threatened by that.  Evolution-of- the-species-at-stake threatened. And I want to win.  I want humans to win.  So I am killing it before it kills me.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You fucking bastard...

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Whose side are you on?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: It's changing characteristics.  It's solidifying taking on weight.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: How quickly?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: If it continues, it will implode from its own weight and turn into a black hole in about four hours and pulls us in with it.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Where's Snow?  Did you call him?

turns.speaker: SARTORIUS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What's wrong?  What happened to Gibarian?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: He's dead.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: You didn't bring any chocolate, did you?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I love chocolate.  I realized just yesterday how much I love it.  I thought maybe, if they let you bring personal effects, you might have snuck some through, because... well, I've been thinking about it.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I can't talk just now.  I'm too tired.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Where's Sartorius?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: In his lab.  He won't let you in.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: He'll let me in.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Kelvin, if you see anything unusual...

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Is there anybody else here?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Why, who did you see?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Gibarian warned me.  He left me a message.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Who was it?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: She was real.  Where did she come from?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Tell me.  I won't think you're insane.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Oh, that's a relief.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: How much sleep do you need?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: How much sleep?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: How long can you go without sleep?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: That depends.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Well, when you do go to sleep: barricade your door.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Was her breakfast conversation that bad?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I told you, try to stay calm.  You're supposed to be the psychologist of the bunch.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Personally, I think it's God.  At least, it fits my definition.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: And professionally?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I'm not sure.  It started with Gibarian.  He locked himself in his room and refused to talk except through a crack in the door.  He covered the video lens. Obviously we thought he was having a nervous breakdown.  I don't know why he didn't tell us he had somebody in there.  By this time, we were getting visitors, too.  He was desperately trying to figure it out.  Day and night.  Who was she?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: My wife.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Dead?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: She has materialized from your memory of her.  What was her name?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Rheya.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: It started about three months ago. Right after the government sold the expedition.  We were ready to go home.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Will she come back?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I wish you'd told me.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Told you what?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What will you say?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: To who?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What are you going to report back to Earth?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: An enormous amount of money changed hands to get control of this project. We are in little danger of being left alone for long.  You'll need to do something. Otherwise they'll be sending someone out to recover you.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Gibarian said he thinks Solaris should be destroyed.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: That's ludicrous.  This is contact. We have found God.  The only issue is figuring out how to prove this in a way that will make sense back on Earth.  So how will we describe it, if we choose to describe it at all?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Kelvin, you awake?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Can you meet me and Sartorius on B deck in an hour?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Just a little strategy session.  But in person this time.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Is it being deliberately cruel, you mean?  I don't think so.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I'm just trying to find an explanation for the continual reappearances.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: When you cut yourself pounding the door, did it hurt?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: You're unnerved because you've spent your whole life thinking nobody is looking over you, and suddenly your subconscious is an open book.  We are, for the first time, experiencing changes in natural reality by a force not our own.  That proves that --

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: -- we are not sure of that.  We are not sure we aren't all hallucinating.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: If God is beyond our comprehension, and she --  -- is here for reasons that can't be understood, isn't God here?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Not necessarily.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Stop equivocating!  Unbelievable, how you equivocate!  You, the atheist, you're more dogmatic than any holy person I've ever seen!  This is happening, Kelvin.  Wake up.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Consciousness is enough, that's all I've saying.  Consciousness should be enough for anybody.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Who are you trying to convince?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: We can liquidate the station.  Take the Athena back.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Of course, when we return, we'll be regarded as lunatics if we tell the truth.  We'll chalk it up to isolation, collective derangement.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I've never heard you express any desire to leave before now.  Why now?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Well, I think we're reaching the point of diminishing returns here, right?  Certainly it's learning more about us than we'll ever learn about it.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: But why is it doing what it's doing? Given it's resources, it could have done anything.  Presented me with your double, and you with mine.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Perhaps it did.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Human beings can die.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: But they are human.  They certainly become human with incredible speed. First they're like they were in our memory, but then they fill in on their own.  DNA doesn't determine the hundreds of trillions of connections that occur in the brain, it's not dense enough.  They build up with experience.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: They come when you sleep.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: That's right.  And we all have to sleep, eventually.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: She drank liquid oxygen.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Why do you think she hasn't suggested that?  It's the most obvious solution: Escape.  She knows she can't leave here --

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Get out --

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Oh, this one you love?  What about the first one, the one you fucked and then put into a rocket and blasted into space?  You didn't love her?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: She knows everything.  She knows who she is.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: She knows everything?  Does she know she came once before and you put her in --

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I want you to get Sartorius to abandon his plan.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What plan?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Just get him to stop.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: What do you want to do, leave the station with her?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Kelvin, she'll disintegrate.  You don't believe me?  Let's radio that shuttle pod you launched -- better yet, let's go get it.  I've charted it's trajectory, only take a few hours...

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Her oxygen would have run out.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Maybe she doesn't need any.  Should we check?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Who are you trying to please? Yourself?  Her?  Which her, this one or that one.  Can you face both?  We are in a situation that is beyond morality.  So: Leave with her.  You'll see the transformation.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Into what?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: You'll see her die, that's all. They're mortal, despite what she told you.  She will die.  Then what will you do?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I love her.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: You do, you don't.  She's willing to give her life, you're willing to give yours, it's touching and magnificent, anything you want but -- this isn't the place for it.  Don't you see?  No, you don't.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What's wrong with you?  We need your help.

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: I won't be making the trip.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: When did this happen?

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: Oh, right away.  That's why you never saw me with anyone.  You should've noticed that.  I miss him, though. I think I made a mistake.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: SNOW
turns.text: But I can't leave with you.  I won't make it.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Maybe you can.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Oh, God.  I'm awake.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I need to see Snow.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I'll just be a minute.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Don't.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I don't know.  I can't be alone.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: To calm your anxiety.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: To calm my anxiety.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: We're taking a flight?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Rheya...

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I want you inside me right now.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: "And Death Shall Have No Dominion".

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Book?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Poem.  Dylan Thomas.  I thought of it when I saw you on the train.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: My Thomas is a little rusty.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Not a very happy poem.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You didn't look very happy.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I wasn't.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: And tonight?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Better.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You want to fuck her?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You behave as though you want to fuck her.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Rheya.  Not here.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: And I just want to know if I'm crazy or not -- if what I think is happening is actually happening.  Or am I one of those people, those women, who are blind to what's going on?  Who pretend not to see their husband's attention toward another woman?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Let's go home.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You go home.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: I am.  Please come with me.  I don't want to do this here.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You talk like an actor.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You're better when you take them.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: I know, I know.  But still, somehow I don't feel better.

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: All right.  How about I feel better when you take them?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: What do you remember?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Do you remember Beethoven?  The Beatles?  Movies, books, restaurants, friends?

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Yes.  But not until you mentioned them.  As soon as you said those things, I remembered them.  And they have associations that make me think of other things I remember.  It's like filling up.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Is it a planet?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Not exactly.  It exists in a continuum that wasn't proven until ten years ago, a higher mathematical dimension superimposed on top of the Universe. An infinite number of them, in fact. It was a violation of all of our various laws regarding the Universe, Space, or Space-Time.  It was completely counter-intuitive.  We had to unlearn everything.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Is it intelligent?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: Intelligent beyond our comprehension.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Then it's God, right?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: It's something.

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: You still don't believe in God?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: The whole idea of God was dreamed up by a silly animal with a small brain called Man.  Even the limits we put on it are human limits.  It can do this, it can do that!  It designs, it creates!

turns.speaker: RHEYA
turns.text: Even a God that wasn't active, that just created something and stood back and watched?

turns.speaker: KELVIN
turns.text: You're talking about a man in a white beard again.  You're ascribing human characteristics to something that isn't human.  Human beings look for causes and patterns.  How could we know what Solaris is up to, if anything?
